intro: Pterospermum fuscum, commonly known as the black pterospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Pterospermum fuscum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
